title: Representing nouns in the Diccionario de aprendizaje del español como lengua extranjera (DAELE)

author: Viviana Mahecha Mahecha, Pompeu Fabra University
Janet DeCesaris, Pompeu Fabra University

segmentation: Good afternoon everybody.
The purpose of our presentation is to show some aspects of the macrostructure and microstructure that we have taken into account to represent nouns in the daily in Spanish dictionary.

Of our presentation are.
Firstly, we are going to talk about E. Lexicography in Spanish tradition.
We will focus on some Spanish monolingual dictionaries that have been produced on syndrome, the Internet, or in both versions.
Secondly, we will present an overview of the Daily project as a monolingual learners dictionary that has been conceived from the very start for the electronic environment thoroughly.

We have taken some decisions about the representation of semantic information, such as semantic labels that I limit extensive use of semantic levels to guide users through the various senses of polysemous words.
There are several types of semantic label.
Sometimes the label is a very brief definition, sometime it is superordinate, other times it's a synonym.
The purpose of this element in the dictionaries microstructure.

Is 2 fold on the one hand it allows no native speakers to quickly and easily identify various senses and on the other it allows us to apply a hierarchical order to sense is progressing from the core sense to derived senses to the rival senses.
Many other online dictionaries, such as the Macmillan English Dictionary Online, the doubles, or the Cambridge advanced.

Dictionary include this sort of semantic label, which appears as a part of a menu with hyperlinks that take users to the corresponding part of the article within that eat semantic levels could be a good research that should be included in our dictionary.
Order of senses establish establishing the criteria for the order of senses is one of the most important decisions in the dialect, in that most of the lexical unit in this project.
Our policies we have decided to organize senses according to semantic criteria.
In this case we present at first the core meaning and subsequently derived senses.

We are convinced that this approach, in conjunction with the use of semantic levels, should help upper intermediate students to understand the meanings provided by the dictionary better since establishes semantic relation between senses definitions.
We are interested in presenting nonsenses in such a way so as to add to the users ability to insert the noun into this course.
